item.title: By: hagen
item.dc:creator: hagen
item.content:encoded:
I’m working at the moment to incorporate data from http://www.naturalearthdata.com/.
Maybe the post will be ready before Christmas.

Update: it’s done, have a look at Plotting the world revisited

item.title: By: Peter Thejll
item.dc:creator: Peter Thejll
item.description: The above was veru helpful! Is there a more detailed world map available somehere? I come from a small country (Denmark) and the lines are all worng :)
item.content:encoded: The above was veru helpful! Is there a more detailed world map available somehere? I come from a small country (Denmark) and the lines are all worng :)

item.title: By: hagen
item.dc:creator: hagen
item.description: @ariel: I have solved your problem: ./../../heat-maps/index.html The tricky part is to have the data file in the correct sequence.
item.content:encoded:
@ariel: I have solved your problem: ./../../heat-maps/index.html
The tricky part is to have the data file in the correct sequence.

item.title: By: hagen
item.dc:creator: hagen
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../comment-page-1/index.html#comment-79">ariel</a>.
Hi Ariel.
This is indeed more complicated, but I will getting into this and probably write an entry on overlaying temperature data.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to ariel.

Hi Ariel.

This is indeed more complicated, but I will getting into this and probably write an entry on overlaying temperature data.

item.title: By: ariel
item.dc:creator: ariel
item.description:
I have a data set with latitude, longitude, and a values (for example temperature). Can I overlay the temperature field on fig 4? If so, how would I go about it? I have not been able to generate a plot like that.
Thanks, Ariel
item.content:encoded:
I have a data set with latitude, longitude, and a values (for example temperature). Can I overlay the temperature field on fig 4? If so, how would I go about it? I have not been able to generate a plot like that.

Thanks,
Ariel
